forge.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to develop something new, especially a strong relationship with other people, groups, or countries
forge.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: In 1776 the United States forged an alliance with France.
The two women had forged a close bond.
Back in the 1980s, they were attempting to forge a new kind of rock music.
forge.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
forge.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
forge.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
forge.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Her speech wasn’t going down too well, but she forged on.
Crowds of people forged through the streets towards the embassy.
He forged into the lead in the fourth set.
forge.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to make something from a piece of metal by heating the metal and shaping it
forge.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects
forge.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a large piece of equipment that produces high temperatures, used for heating and shaping metal objects
forge.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to produce a document or money that is not GENUINE (=real), or to sign something with a false name
forge.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: They had forged some company documents and set up phoney  (=false) bank accounts.
Someone stole my cheque book and forged my signature.
forge.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to establish a relationship of working together with another person, organization or country
forge.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Air France also forged an alliance with Delta Air Lines, helped by a the open-skies deal between France and the U.S.
A number of links have been forged between Danish and American companies.
Both General Motors and Ford would like to forge a liaison with Jaguar.
The US hopes to forge a closer economic relationship with East European countries.
forge.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: to make an agreement with another person, organization, or country
forge.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: They forged an agreement with the Philips to produce two games using the electronics company’s Compact Disc-Interactive format.
